paper_abstract: We consider a stochastic model of clock synchronization in a wireless network of sensors interacting with one dedicated accurate time server. For large we find an estimate of the final time sychronization error for global and relative synchronization. The main results concern the behavior of the network on different timescales t(N) ->infinity, N -> infinity . We discuss the existence of phase transitions and find the exact timescales for which an effective clock synchronization of the system takes place.
paper_title: Clock synchronization in symmetric stochastic networks
